articles.content:
Projected introduction of U.S.-made weapons under fire 
    Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- The South Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon) reportedly issued a statement on March 28 dismissing the announced decision of the "ministry of national defense" to select "F-15 K" as fighters of the next generation as a humiliating act of yielding to the U.S. pressure put upon South Korea to buy them.
 Recalling that the defense ministry banned the disclosure of the recorded tape revealing the pressure put by the ministry and an order issued by it to the military as regards the selection in favour of the U.S. and punished an officer for issuing a declaration of conscience, the statement described the present defense ministry as "part of the U.S. Defense Department and an enterprise in service to the U.S. munition industry."    
 The statement charged that the selection of fighters of the next generation is "an act going against the national trend toward independent reunification growing strong after the publication of the June 15 joint declaration.

articles.content:
Greetings to congress of Italian Communist Reestablishment Party
    Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea today sent a message of greetings to the 5th congress of the Communist Reestablishment Party of Italy.
 The WPK is pleased with the vigorous struggle the party has waged to strengthen and develop the party and protect the interests of the popular masses despite the complicated situation since its last congress, the message said, extending full support and solidarity with the just struggle of the party.    
 Believing that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties would grow stronger through a joint struggle for the victory of the socialist cause, it sincerely wished the party congress a big success.

Special envoy of south side arrives
    Pyongyang, April 3 (KCNA) -- Rim Tong Won, special adviser to President Kim Dae Jung on diplomacy, security and unification, arrived here today in the capacity of his special envoy.
 He and his party were greeted at the airport by Kim Wan Su, vice-chairman of the Korean Asia-Pacific Peace Committee.
